mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: At heart, it’s about as naughty as an old Disney movie with Dean Jones, Suzanne Pleshette, and an unruly Great Dane. I liked its gung-ho slapstick spirit, though. No one’s slacking off.

Segel and Diaz are gifted and game comedians, with a lot of audience appeal. But Lowe clearly upstages them, consummating their Sex Tape — and making you want to roll over and have a cigarette — while there’s still one reel to go.
Sex Tape feels like the halves of two different movies. There is a fun, believable comedy about family life... that is upended by the overly broad, barely funny attempts at reclaiming the sex tape.
As supposedly taboo-smashing comedy, it’s never on full thrust, settling more for tentative gags with underwear firmly in place.
It's clumsy and wacky and intermittently amusing, and Rob Lowe looks like he's having a great time playing Real-Life Ned Flanders With a Deeply Weird Side once again.
The film wants to be wild and dark and crazy, but it's also a big studio summer movie, and so it feels like it flirts with truly insane material, but without ever really committing to it.
Sex Tape is warmer and more amusing than its ads would lead one to believe. In fact, it’s almost good enough, leaning a little too hard on the innate likability of stars Cameron Diaz and Jason Segel.

Two fundamental problems afflict Sex Tape (aside from the fact that it's not consistently funny): a shocking ignorance about the state of modern technology and a mistaken belief that the subject matter is inherently edgy.
It's just an exhausted idea coasting on the charm of its stars.

This frantic farce about a married couple whose video frolic goes viral would be much less bearable without the topspin Segel imparts to even his silliest dialogue. But he looks hollow-eyed and gaunt, like a man starving himself to prove a point. I want the old, lumpy Jason Segel back. Eat, bubbe, eat.

About a third of it is a brilliant setup - but it's for a joke that never happens, at least not completely. A comedy, especially a broad sex comedy, needs to go to extremes. But Sex Tape is a little careful and contained.
The main reason that Sex Tape, while often quite funny, fails to qualify as a comedy is the absence of any real conflict or complication.
Sex Tape is not quite the train wreck its TV ads make it out to be.
At 100-minutes, the movie drags and drags until finally losing steam in the last act and then collapses into a pile of worn out platitudes, limp gross out gags and gooey sentiment.

In the end, Sex Tape doesn't seduce, doesn't surprise and certainly doesn't satisfy. It only leaves you feeling a little taken advantaged of, as you take your walk of shame back to your car – and hoping you never hear from it again.

Another limp, almost laugh-free comedy to add to Diaz's long list of failures, Kasdan's Sex Tape fails to ignite the obvious chemistry between her and the usually solid Segel, himself in possibly his least entertaining performance.
Ultimately, for all its running around in the middle of the night, Sex Tape plays it remarkably coy, reaffirming love, not lust. It’s the cinematic equivalent of sleeping in the wet spot.
Sex Tape, conversely, is as timid, bland, and predictable as romantic comedies come — though it’s a hard movie to hate entirely.
Since it's a comedy, much could be forgiven if the film was consistent in generating laughs, but the comedy is as erratic as the couple's sex life.
An awkward and distinctly unsexy farcical misfire.
Sex Tape is a case study in how little interest American movies—and especially American sex comedies—have in dealing with sex as anything other than a source of cheap giggles and nonstop humiliation.
How could a movie that offers Jason Segel riffing on sex and Cameron Diaz regularly disrobing be so dull?
Viewers seeking a fresh comedy, a seductive romp, or even just an escape from boredom for a couple hours will be left dismally unsatisfied by this stilted, nearly humorless, non-titillating slog.

Now, Diaz and Segel co-star for Kasdan again in Sex Tape, but their characters are so indiscernible as actual human beings, it’s hard to tell who they are, much less whether they have any sort of enjoyable, raunchy chemistry.

The cinematic equivalent of herpes, Sex Tape is an uncomfortable embarrassment to raunchy comedies everywhere. Fortunately, no medication is required after being exposed to it: The effects are not permanent, only painful.
Sex Tape settles for violence when violent slapstick, a lot harder to finesse, was the implicit goal of the picture.
It’s less a movie than a bad sitcom episode stretched to feature length and raunched up to an R rating.
For a movie filled with amateur porn, sex toys, cocaine and Cameron Diaz's butt, "Sex Tape" is awfully tame. You're in greater danger of taking a nap than needing a safe word.
Instead of soft core, Sex Tape offers no core. No narrative core, just a not-bad notion executed execrably; no core of conviction, just two stars trudging joylessly through swamps of mediocrity.

Sex Tape is a hustler of a film — it works very hard for its laughs — but it's so haphazardly directed (by Jake Kasdan) and written (by Kate Angelo and Segel and Nicholas Stoller) that it can easily be divided into three distinct sections.
Sex Tape is sexcruciating.
Sex Tape is an unaccountable drag — strained, toothless and far too tame to achieve the sort of outrageous, raunchy-titillating effect it’s aiming for.
It is a bland, clawless comedy; a cautionary tale of a high concept gone horribly, horribly wrong.

The most important question is one that should be answered before setting foot in the theatre, and it is this: How badly do you want to see Cameron Diaz’s butt? If your answer is so very badly, or even pretty darn bad, then by all means, buy a ticket.
By the time a blackmailing plot is introduced, the film seems to be surviving solely on the fumes of curse words and frequent shots of Jason Segal and Cameron Diaz's backsides.
Massively stupid: preposterous yet boring.

mc_user_reviews.text: It's ridiculously raunchy and dirty, and at the same time it's also painfully cringe-inducing and unfunny. Cameron Diaz and Jason Segel try far too hard in this film and a majority of the gags fall flat on their face. And at the film's halfway mark, it becomes surprisingly boring. A few mildly amusing one-liners as well as a random, pointless five-minute cameo from Jack Black couldn't even save this one. Easily the worst comedy I've seen all year.

It had become very apparent to me early on during my viewing of “Sex Tape” that Cameron Diaz, and Jason Siegel were going to have remarkable on screen chemistry. Then the unthinkable happened, the first five minutes ended. Where to begin? is a question that is never asked in the treacherous debacle that is “Sex Tape”. A bland attempt at a lude-and raunchy R rated comedy, that is not only poorly scripted, but severely unfunny in all the wrong ways.

Cameron Diaz & Jason Segel play a married couple who decide to spice up their sex life by recording it. Needless to say, it gets out of their hands, which is supposed to cause a zany time. As a screen couple, Diaz provides the hot and Segel handles the comedy. Unfortunately, the majority of the movie is spent with them in mediocre banter and their chemistry isn't special. The attempts at madcap situations are overblown and silly. Despite the efforts at outrageous humor and enuff F-bombs to make Tarantino blush, most of the gags fall flaccid (pun intended). The upbeat energy keeps it moving, but the genuine laffs are overclouded by everyone trying too hard (pun also intended).

If a movie is crude and offensive the least that can be expected is that it is also funny and well written. Sex Tape is neither. The holes in the story rival those in Swiss cheese and the jokes are sophomoric.  In addition to this, the Rob Lowe character and the names of his family members border on being anti-Semitic; they are not only offensive stereotypes but seem to have been thrown in gratuitously since the characterizations don't even have relevance to the story.
Absolutely horrible movie!No funny moments and total lack of humor.I nearly fell asleep after a few minutes. Do not see this movie on cinema,waste of money!
Horrible movie. Not FUNNY. It was cool to see these two on screen in bad teacher and this is obviously trying to piggyback off the success of that. it FAILS.

Well where to start... bad acting bad writing bad "jokes" (if you can say that this movie has any) despite Cameron Diaz small "almost good acting" that are often very few just because the screen play writing do not give the actors any good chance to act better. Because the obvious characters behaviors by the situations they are facing is it lacks of a better development in their part. This isn't juts another awful movie, no no. It is a disgusting "funny movie" Mixing funny with nudity is never have been great.

An terrible excuse for an Comedy Movie stupid jokes nearly only sex and toilet humor. The acting is also very bad  exaped for diaz on some parts. The Story is also just offensive and another thing that is a big problem in my eyes is the maine character , he is just not that likebal that you want to see him go thout all that.

This movie really shows you what happens when you have a great concept, great actors, and zero script or direction.  The movie is saved, for me, by two scenes - the Rob Lowe Slayer sequence (love me some Angel of Death) - and the Jack Black sequence in which he's listing all the potential competitors to YouPorn that he thinks our hero is representing.  Hilarious stuff.  Hearkens back to the list of pornos that the sidekick from Clerks lists off to his video supplier.

Very poor script, combined with very poor direction, plus levels of vulgarity beyond reasonable, make for one of the worst movies in the reccent past.  The premise had promise, but the execution, from start to finish couldn´t have been worse.  I am surprised Cameron Diaz agreed to participate in such a project.  She declared that she took some clothes off in this fillm because "the pay was good".  Was it really worth it?
In a year of bad comedies (Walk of Shame, The Other Woman, Blended) Sex Tape continues the trend.  Characters doing really dumb things for really dumb reasons.  D

Not as bad as I thought it would be but still not good. Laughed a few times through the movie but not as much as you want from a comedy. A good cameo at the end that was funny and made the movie a bit better. Some funny moments but still not good at all.
It is enjoyable to see the chemistry between Jason Segel and Cameron Diaz evolve, in a not so great, cliched, raunchy sex comedy about a burned out relationship.

Until this day I still don´t get why so many people think Cameron Diaz and Jason Siegel are super funny. I just don´t. I have liked inly like 2 movies of Diaz and none of Jason movies. This movie is so bad in so many ways that u almost feel sorry for them...almost.
The worst example of a comedy film. It is like a parody of American Pie, and the script doesn't make sense to realize the beauty of a comedy film about sex.
Shamelessly crude and offensive, Sex Tape offers a few moments of genuine hilarity - but all in all, is a very forgettable comedy which is ill suited to its genuinely funny leads.

The movie Sex Tape isn't bad. Though, I wouldn't consider it to be a comedy movie. Lifestyle movie? Maybe. But there are a few memorable moments on the movie. If you wanna learn how to do sex, this movie could possibly help you how to do it. Oh yeah, I forgot to mention one of the most memorable moment you guys might like is probably the dog biting scene. So my suggestion, go on and see it.

I know what this is going. And yes, Rob Lowe did indeed had a sex tape on his own way back. But to be fair, why is Sex Tape the name of this title movie? I didn't see the movie because I thought it was supposed to be as good as Bad Teacher, but then again I just don't understand with a bland script and mimicking American Pie, Old School, and all of its raunchy teen comedies just happens to be the movie's biggest blunder. But extra points to Rob Lowe. I definitely love this guy delivering a performance that he totally mocks himself lately. Hey, he hosted SNL. Either way, Sex Tape is one of the weirdest but absolute worst movie of 2014 so far.

So, so, sooooo bad, and I'm talking Beverly Hills Cop 3 bad. Appalling dialogue and we are led to believe that Cameron Diaz, who's stunning figure we see naked from behind multiple times, has body confidence issues.

There isn't much to excite you in Sex Tape. The dialogue is at times so poor, you'd be better off watching this on mute. It attempts to amuse you with absurdity, but unfortunately the joke's on the film.

Probably the laziest comedy I have ever seen. It seems like as little effort as possible went into making it. As if the only reason it exists is out of some contractual obligation. There are a lot of great, funny people here who give it no effort. The jokes are so bland and unoriginal that it's evident writer Kate Angelo just took bits and pieces of unfunny jokes from other comedies and through them in with original gags that lack humor in every way.

Oh how much potential this movie had. I'm not going to lie, this movie had me laughing to tears for the first hour. It's one of the funniest and most original comedies I've seen since The Hangover and it was on pace for a 10/10 rating. Then the writers had the ultimate fail and ruined the plot.

From the cast and crew that brought you Bad Teacher, comes Sex Tape, and on the surface it had all the makings of the next big comedic hit. Many people were saying that Sex Tape could be the next Hangover, as it is an original idea with an all-star cast, but sadly it falls well short of expectations. Annie & Jay's marriage has become a little stale, so one night they decide to spice things up by making a Sex Tape. Jay is a music producers and inexplicably neglects the fact that his laptop is connected to many other devices, and the tape finds its way to the cloud. Once again, Jason Segel and Cameron Diaz have absolutely no chemistry. They are too different types of actors that just don't compliment each other and they are even less believable as a married couple. If that were the only issue with this film, maybe I could have gotten passed it, but the real problem, as with Bad Teacher, is that the writers don't know their audience. This is an R rated film about a sex tape and in no way meant for children, yet the jokes are on a sixth grade level. As an adult going to see a raunchy comedy, I'm not interested in jokes about erections and diarrhea, it's in very poor taste and isn't something many adults will respond to. This film is supposed to be a laugh out loud comedy, but there was barely even a snicker in the movie theater, which basically tells you all you need to know about this film. Sex Tape is trying to get people to see it under the guise of being raunchy and featuring some pretty attractive stars, that fans hope they will get to see naked. The truth is that it is very amateurish, you really don't see all that much, and the jokes could be out of PG movie. All in all, Sex Tape is a big disappointment and a huge waste of time.
We all knew going into this one what we were likely to find. For the most part, we are unimpressed. Occasionally, however, there is slight magic between our two leads.

An incredibly dull and boring film. I have laughed more in heavy drama films than I did in this one. It incorporates some of the worst dialogue of the year with a concept that gets old after 10 minutes. A shameful excuse to make a movie.

It's funny. I laughed. Not sure why people are loathing this film. There are wore comedies this year (Tammy), there are as funny comedies this year (Million Ways to Die) and there much funnier films (Jump Street). If you can overlook the structure flaws, it should be a good enough time.

At times the film isn't entertaining, it's just so funny and bad at the same time. A talent actress like Cameron Diaz won't go far with her humor. However i did laugh a lot and Jason Segel is like a comedic sidekick. So i did enjoy it. Grade C+

When comedies are stupid and they are funny, they're clever. When comedies are stupid, but they are not humorous, then it's stupid. This problem threatens to happen here, in "Sex Tape", a relentlessly cringe-worthy comedic film that while carries a charming chemistry from its main stars and a naughty premise, it falls flat with its jokes. If you wanna see this, I only recommend you that you pirate it or just wait 'till comes to cable TV. Other than that, please, stay away from this.
At first, I was so bored that I wanted to stop him. Honestly not much liked, a little boring. From the Trailer looked interesting, but that's a... bad movie.
If you have seen the trailer you have seen the movie. This film was an absolute atrocity by far one of the worst of the year, it was simply a product placement for apple and and a waste of talent.
This movie was mediocre, just like every movie that has come out this year. Save your money by not going to the theater. Go spend it on.... anything else. Go donate it to charity.
most of it is pretty good, but not great. The middle of the film, where they actually try to retrieve the tape is where the film sags like a flat tire.
One joke movie that becomes boring despite stars' best efforts.  Sex does not fix an ultra weak script anymore.  Cameron Diaz is also looking old.  She needed a bit of photo-shopping.

It was funny, just not funny enough to keep me entertained the whole 90+ minutes.  Opening was cute, setup of plot was fun, but after that, it pretty much headed downhill and only had a few laughs in a couple of places.  In places, it seemed as if they were trying to stretch the movie our as gags just kept going and going with no real progress on the story.

Sex Tape is essentially a 90-minute Apple commercial. A promising premise is wasted on a slow-paced, unrealistic and disjointed storyline. The comedy bounces all over the place, unsure of how racy it should be, which in turn wastes the great cast. What ends up on the screen is a family farce film filled with corny, forced humour. This film is should only be watched if you're a fan of Cameron Diaz or Jason Segel, because if you're looking for any story or intelligent jokes you wont find it here.
"Sex Tape" 10 Scale Rating: 1.5 (Awful) ...

All the other reviews I've read on this site about this movie I do think are very fair. As a 22 year old I honestly think Sex Tape did a pretty good job of being both entertaining and funny and if I'm honest i prefer it over Bad Teacher. The story isn't great but in my opinion that is not what you watch a comedy for. As a comedy Sex Tape does a great job of getting laughs out of what can be considered a very awkward and embarrassing situation. I love the crude humor and the gags on how aging people are loosing their touch with technology. All in all it is a great 'balls out' comedy which will keep most young entertained the whole way through.

Cameron Diaz needs to pick better movies then this. This has to be the most unfunny and the most painfully movie that I had to sit throw. The characters are so stupid and the writing is the most lazy writing that I have seen in my life. I laughed once during this movie and that's it, sex tape is the most lazy comedy that I seen this year and I tried to find something good in this movie but I couldn't.
Very carp movie rude dumb imhate movies like this ivan milat series is a lot better I think so. Crap tape more like it  very dumb if you are gay or lesbian never watch that **** **** movie yucky
Sex tape is an awful comedy with poorly executed jokes and only exists to showcase apple products not to mention the movie is very tame for a film called sex  tape
Very poor attempt at comedy with a terribly contrived story shackled to a script which is littered with "comic" simulated sex scenes and a lot of very cynical Apple product placement.
Look, I want to delete this review to be honest, but I cannot so you might need to bear with this useless review till the 150 characters are all written down.
